other_tests.findings: Normal sinus rhythm; ST-segment elevations of 1 to 2 mm in leads V2 to V4, with a biphasic T wave in V3; and deep, symmetric T-wave inversions in leads V4 to V6.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A repeat electrocardiogram showed persistent ST-segment elevation and T-wave inversions.

other_tests.findings: Minimal luminal irregularities with no evidence of plaque rupture or thrombus.
Ejection fraction of 35%; moderate mitral regurgitation; mild ventricular systolic dysfunction with akinesis of the apex, mid anterior wall, mid anteroseptum, mid septum, and mid posterior wall.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A repeat echocardiogram one month after discharge showed left ventricular hypertrophy with normal left ventricular function, estimated ejection fraction of 75%, and resolution of the mitral regurgitation.
